Semester 2: AnyARH 2000-level survey course exceptARH 2000(Critical Tracking;Gen Ed Humanities) (CT)
Semester 3: Any 2000-level ARH survey course exceptARH 2000(Critical Tracking) (CT)
State Core Gen Ed Mathematics (3 credits)
Major electives (Critical Tracking; Any 2000-level course with a GRA / ARH / ART / ARE / PGY / DIG prefix) (CT) (9 credits)
Semester 4: Quest 2 (Gen Ed Physical or Biological Sciences) (3 credits)
Gen Ed Mathematics; pure math (3 credits)
Major electives (Critical Tracking; Any 2000-level course with a GRA / ARH / ART / ARE / PGY / DIG prefix) (CT) (9 credits)
Semester 5: Before beginning 3/4000 studio coursework, students must successfully submit and pass the sophomore portfolio review.
Semester 6: State Core Gen Ed Biological or Physical Sciences (3 credits)
Semester 7: State Core Gen Ed Social and Behavioral Sciences (3 credits)
Gen Ed Social and Behavioral Sciences (3 credits)
Semester 8: State Core Gen Ed Humanities (3 credits)
Any Gen Ed Humanities, Social and Behavioral Science, Physical Science, or Biological Science course (3 credits)
